title: Liandry's Torment is currently broken
body:
The following is a bug report I just sent in because we just figured it out.  If you build Liandry's Torment, you're losing damage because the item is bugged.  Try replicating it for yourself in the practice tool.

â€‹While in game many times we noticed that we would do no damage so my friend and I jumped into the practice tool and were able to replicate it.
(Most easily replicated on amumu)
1, build liandrys torment
2, put out a training dummy
3, turn on w and burn the dummy (note 3 types damage tickers: 2 magic (blue) and 1 % of health (white))
4, walk away and let the dummy heal with w still going
5, walk back up to the dummy and let the w hit it again (% of health (white) damage is gone, dps is changed too)

this can be remedied if you auto attack the target (It allows the % of health damage to burn again)
This is amazingly detrimental to ranged mages considering most close range champions don't build liandrys.

Expected result, Liandrys burns for a percentage of their health
Actual result, Liandrys shows the animation but does no extra damage

-BSR

A lot of people are saying the white dmg tick is from amumu, but like I said, I tested this on a lot of champs.

Here's a few stills I took.  I don't have video or anything, but you can see the white damage (supposedly from amumu).  If it were amumu's true dmg, why does fid, kaisa, and ziggs do true dmg?

https://imgur.com/a/Y6zWz23

After inspecting the pictures, i found the reason.

You are using cheap shot rune from domination tree and that causes the white damage (true damage).

https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Cheap_Shot

To see for yourself, click the link and hover over the damage numbers in the rune description and it will show you how much damage it does on each champion level. The numbers match your levels and damages on the pictures.

Try to get white damage on ziggs or fiddle etc without using cheap shot and it shouldn't happen anymore.

Seems to be something to do with one skill being pressed and lasting (I would guess) longer than 3 seconds based on what you said. It bugs out when no new inputs have happened so it isn't getting triggered again to start the burn. Seems like this would impact a very small subset of champs but maybe I am reading this wrong?

It's not just one skill being pressed and lasting.  With fiddlesticks, throwing an e (Dark Wind) anyone hit doesn't take burn damage unless you auto attack.  Fear, drain, ult...none matter until you auto attack them once to reset the debuff.  I think it has something to do with their healing.  I've found they don't have to heal all the way back up either.  If they heal at all then it's like it turns liandry's off.  After testing this in several ARAMs with Kai'sa (w), Lissandra (q,w,e,r), Nasus (e), and Shaco (w,e), I've found it affects them too.

Also, after hitting one person (and they heal any) and you hit a different person, the burn doesn't go on the other person.  You HAVE to auto attack the champion to reset the burn.  You can't even auto attack a minion.  I've been testing it on most champs I've tried.  If they have an ap ratio, it affects them.  Auto attack based champs like Diana, Akali, etc. would still be affected, but they wouldn't feel the effects of it since they auto attack so often.

Any ranged poke champions get kind of devastated.
Liandry's is working as intended. The OP is just misunderstanding how amumu works which causes all the confusion.

This is similar to the Morello and Red Buff bugs in TFT - if the burn lasts longer than "x", where x is the amount of time for the standard burn effect (I think it's over 4 seconds on Liandri? I know its 10s on the TFT items) then the burn will stop applying damage. Meaning, on people who dont constantly re-apply burn damage from the same spell (i.e., if you built it on Ryze) then it should work normally. But on someone who applies the debuff multiple times from the same spell (any DoT effect, or summon effect...Teemo, Fid, Zyra, Amumu, etc...) then the burn will stop applying from that spell after x time has passed, even though the spell should be reseting Liandri's on every tick of the DoT, or attack from the summon.

They can theoretically fix this in the same manner they did the TFT item bugs.

This is not broken as I have tested it out myself and there is NO BUG and NO PROBLEM WITH LIANDRY'S TORMENT. The confusion comes either from the Amumu passive, or a possible use of the "Cheapshot" under the domination tree (first row rune). This would cause true damage to impaired units (i.e. unites who are disabled/slowed in some way). OP mentioned a few champs and some of them fit this bill (Shaco w,e; Liss q,w,e,r) but some don't (Nasus e; Kai'sa w). The screenshot of Ziggs shows true damage values of "16" and "28" which would be consistent with the 15-45 true damage range of "Cheap Shot"; this makes sense as Ziggs' e slows and would thus be able to proc "Cheap Shot". However, "Cheap Shot" has a 4 second cooldown which would mean some other form of true damage is responsible in addition to, or instead of "Cheap Shot".

In conclusion, Liandry's is working AS INTENDED. The form of true damage must be coming from another source and with my guess being rune related. Liandry's should not AND DOES NOT do true damage (white number text).
